author: @philstarnews
title: Better Than Gold | Philstar.com
text:
[Wisdom] is a tree of life to those who take hold of her. â€” Proverbs 3:18
When gold seeker Edward Jackson set out for California during the Great Gold Rush in the US, his diary entry on May 20, 1849, lamented his grueling wagon journey, marked by disease and death. â€œO do not leave my bones here,â€ he wrote. â€œIf possible let them lay at home.â€ Another gold-seeker named John Walker penned, â€œIt is the most complete lottery that you can imagine . . . . I cannot advise any person to come.â€
Walker, in fact, returned home and succeeded at farming, ranching, and state politics. When a family member took Walkerâ€™s yellowing letters to the American TV program Antiques Roadshow, they were valued at several thousand dollars. Said the TV host, â€œSo he did get something valuable out of the Gold Rush. The letters.â€
Even more, both Walker and Jackson returned home after gaining wisdom that caused them to take hold of a more practical life. Consider these words about wisdom from King Solomon, â€œBlessed are those who find wisdom . . . . She is a tree of life to those who take hold of herâ€ (Proverbs 3:13, 18). A wise choice is â€œmore profitable than silver and yields better returns than goldâ€ (v. 14) â€” making wisdom more precious than any earthly desire (v. 15).
â€œLong life is in her right hand . . . and all her paths are peaceâ€ (vv. 16â€“17). Our challenge, therefore, is to hold tight to wisdom, not shiny wishes. Itâ€™s a path God will bless. â€” Patricia Raybon
What shiny wishes have you been chasing in life? Where could the path of wisdom take you instead?
Heavenly Father, when Iâ€™m blinded by the lure of shiny wishes, inspire me to take hold of wiser choices, walking the path of wisdom back to Your blessed peace.
Follow us on social media: ourdailybreadpilipinas, web: odb.org and filipino-odb.org,
and check our resources at ourdailybreadpilipinas.org.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Trump Is Back on Coloradoâ€™s Primary Ballotâ€”for Now
text: As Donald Trump faces a quartet of indictments on top of a civil fraud trial that could strip him of his businesses, the embattled former president is back on the ballot in Colorado . The Colorado Republican Party on Wednesday appealed to the U.S. Supreme Court in a bid to overturn the Colorado Supreme Courtâ€™s Dec. 19 ruling that â€œfound by clear and convincing evidence that President Trump engaged in insurrectionâ€ on Jan. 6, 2021, thus declaring him ineligible to hold office under the U.S. Constitutionâ€™s insurrection clause . Trump would be stricken from the stateâ€™s 2024 presidential primary ballot, the court ruled, simultaneously staying the decision until Jan. 4 in the event of a GOP appeal. In their appeal, Republican Party lawyers argued that the Colorado Supreme Court showed â€œunprecedented disregardâ€ for the First Amendment rights of political parties and voters to pick a candidate of their choosing. On Thursday, Colorado Secretary of State Jena Griswoldâ€™s office issued a statement, saying, â€œWith the appeal filed, Donald Trump will be included as a candidate on Coloradoâ€™s 2024 Presidential Primary Ballot when certification occurs on January 5, 2024, unless the U.S. Supreme Court declines to take the case or otherwise affirms the Colorado Supreme Court ruling.â€ In a comment provided by her spokesman, Griswold emphasized her support for the original ban, a 4-3 ruling, to stand. â€œDonald Trump engaged in insurrection and was disqualified under the Constitution from the Colorado Ballot,â€ Griswold said. â€œThe Colorado Supreme Court got it right. This decision is now being appealed. I urge the U.S. Supreme Court to act quickly given the upcoming presidential primary election.â€ Section 3 of the Constitutionâ€™s 14th Amendment was added following the Civil War, and was intended to block members of the Confederacy from returning to power. Legal theorists have been split on whether or not Trump should be disqualified, hinging primarily on whether or not he was â€œan officer of the United Statesâ€ while serving as president. The U.S. Supreme Court has never before ruled on the issue. Multiple efforts to disqualify Trump from the ballot in numerous states have been playing out in recent months. On Wednesday, the Michigan Supreme Court decided to allow Trumpâ€™s name to appear on the stateâ€™s primary ballot. Trump has decried the attempts to block him from running as a â€œpathetic gambitâ€ to rig the election. Read more at The Daily Beast.

author: DEXWireNews
title: Apple Revolutionizes Mac Line with AI-Focused M4 Chips: ðŸðŸ’»
text:
[](/u/DEXWireNews/)
Apple Revolutionizes Mac Line with AI-Focused M4 Chips: ðŸðŸ’»
[BATS:AAPL](/symbols/NASDAQ-AAPL/)Apple Inc
In a bid to revolutionize its computer lineup and bolster artificial intelligence (AI) capabilities, Apple Inc. (
The M4 chips, slated to succeed the M3 processors released just five months ago, represent a significant leap forward in Apple's AI strategy. With plans to integrate AI capabilities into every Mac model, Apple (
The new chips, which will come in at least three main varieties, are designed to enhance efficiency, safety, and delivery speed for consumers. With names like Donan, Brava, and Hidra, these chips promise to deliver unparalleled performance and seamless integration with Apple's ecosystem.
The timing of the rollout couldn't be more critical, as Mac sales witnessed a decline of 27% in the last fiscal year. By infusing its Mac lineup with cutting-edge AI technology, Apple aims to breathe new life into its computer business and regain its competitive edge in the market.
But the implications of Apple's AI-focused M4 chips extend far beyond the realm of computer sales. With the potential to transform industries and reshape the future of work, these chips herald a new era of innovation and possibility.
As Apple (
In a landscape where AI is increasingly becoming ubiquitous, Apple's bold move to overhaul its entire Mac line with AI-focused M4 chips is a testament to its commitment to pushing the boundaries of innovation and shaping the future of technology.
As the tech giant continues its journey towards greater integration of AI into its products, the possibilities are limitless. With the M4 chips at the helm, Apple is paving the way for a future where AI-powered devices revolutionize the way we work, play, and connect.
Technical Outlook
Apple Inc. (
The 4-month price chart candlestick shows a bullish Harami candle stick pattern which further validates the bullish analysis of the thesis.
[AAPL](/symbols/NASDAQ-AAPL/)) is set to unveil a new family of in-house processors, the M4 chips. The move comes as a response to sluggish computer sales and a growing need to integrate advanced technologies into its products.
The M4 chips, slated to succeed the M3 processors released just five months ago, represent a significant leap forward in Apple's AI strategy. With plans to integrate AI capabilities into every Mac model, Apple (
[AAPL](/symbols/NASDAQ-AAPL/)) is poised to redefine the boundaries of innovation in the tech industry.
The new chips, which will come in at least three main varieties, are designed to enhance efficiency, safety, and delivery speed for consumers. With names like Donan, Brava, and Hidra, these chips promise to deliver unparalleled performance and seamless integration with Apple's ecosystem.
The timing of the rollout couldn't be more critical, as Mac sales witnessed a decline of 27% in the last fiscal year. By infusing its Mac lineup with cutting-edge AI technology, Apple aims to breathe new life into its computer business and regain its competitive edge in the market.
But the implications of Apple's AI-focused M4 chips extend far beyond the realm of computer sales. With the potential to transform industries and reshape the future of work, these chips herald a new era of innovation and possibility.
As Apple (
[AAPL](/symbols/NASDAQ-AAPL/)) gears up to release the updated computers beginning late this year and extending into early next year, the tech world eagerly anticipates the unveiling of these groundbreaking devices. With promises of sustainable earnings growth and enhanced user experiences, Apple's M4-powered Macs are poised to set new standards of excellence in the industry.
In a landscape where AI is increasingly becoming ubiquitous, Apple's bold move to overhaul its entire Mac line with AI-focused M4 chips is a testament to its commitment to pushing the boundaries of innovation and shaping the future of technology.
As the tech giant continues its journey towards greater integration of AI into its products, the possibilities are limitless. With the M4 chips at the helm, Apple is paving the way for a future where AI-powered devices revolutionize the way we work, play, and connect.
Technical Outlook
Apple Inc. (
[AAPL](/symbols/NASDAQ-AAPL/)) stock is up by 4.33% trading within the moderate buy zone with a Relative Strength Index (RSI) of 54.72 indicating further room for growth.
The 4-month price chart candlestick shows a bullish Harami candle stick pattern which further validates the bullish analysis of the thesis.

author: Armando HernÃ¡ndez
title: Joe Biden asegura que Kamala Harris â€œEstÃ¡ calificada para ser presidentaâ€
text:
Recientemente, una encuesta de ABC News/Washington Post/Ipsos mostrÃ³ que la vicepresidenta Kamala Harris ganarÃ­a contra el virtual candidato republicano Donald Trump y tal parece que Joe Biden mira de reojo dicho ejercicio estadÃ­stico.
Sin hacer referencia a dicha encuesta, el presidente de Estados Unidos, Joe Biden, expresÃ³ este jueves su confianza en la vicepresidenta, Kamala Harris, afirmando que no la habrÃ­a elegido como su compaÃ±era de fÃ³rmula en las elecciones de 2020 si no estuviera convencido de que podrÃ­a ejercer el cargo de la Presidencia â€œdesde el principioâ€.
â€œ No la habrÃ­a elegido si no hubiera pensado que estaba cualificada para ser presidenta desde el principio. No me ando con rodeos en eso. Ella estÃ¡ cualificada para ser presidenta â€œ, afirmÃ³ el mandatario en una rueda de prensa en los mÃ¡rgenes de la cumbre de la OTAN en Washington.
Conferencia de Biden, en vivo: el presidente enfrenta reto tras varios errores https://t.co/lawd6ftkMr
â€” La OpiniÃ³n (@LaOpinionLA) July 11, 2024 Harris suena como la Ãºnica opciÃ³n viable si Biden se viera obligado a retirarse de la contienda a estas alturas de la campaÃ±a, a un mes de la convenciÃ³n del partido demÃ³crata, debido a las dudas sobre su edad (81 aÃ±os) y su capacidad para renovar un mandato de cuatro aÃ±os en noviembre.
Biden alabÃ³ a su vicepresidenta, que en ante una hipotÃ©tica incapacidad del mandatario asumirÃ­a el poder.
â€œHa manejado temas de libertad de los cuerpos de la mujeres y el control de sus cuerpos muy bien. Segundo, ha mostrado capacidad de manera casi cualquier tema. Es una dura fiscal. Es una sola frase: es muy buenaâ€, insistiÃ³ Biden.
Las encuestas tras en debate presidencial del 27 de junio contra el republicano Donald Trump dan una mayor ventaja a Harris en una hipotÃ©tico enfrentamiento electoral en noviembre si Biden se retirase por las presiones de algunos miembros de su partido.
El mal desempeÃ±o del mandatario en ese cara a cara elevÃ³ las dudas sobre su capacidad de vencer a Trump en noviembre y de seguir en el poder un segundo mandato, que finalizarÃ­a a los 86 aÃ±os.
Pese a ello, el discurso de Biden mp ha cambiado y ha rechazado retirarse y asegurÃ³ hoy de nuevo que es el mejor posicionado para vencer a Trump.
*Con informaciÃ³n de EFE.
Sigue leyendo:
â€¢ Conferencia de Biden: el presidente enfrentÃ³ reto tras crÃ­ticas sobre su capacidad para ser candidato
â€¢ Biden confunde a Zelenski y lo llama Putin en cumbre de la OTAN
â€¢ Â¿CÃ³mo ven los latinos a Kamala Harris? CampaÃ±a de Biden estÃ¡ evaluando las encuestas

author: Zachary Rogers
title: Vietnam Veteran Who Battled Terminal Cancer Alone Honored With a Heroâ€™s Burial in Massachusetts
text: Vietnam Veteran Who Battled Terminal Cancer Alone Honored With a Heroâ€™s Burial in Massachusetts 'May God bless Charlie Connolly, and all who took the time to Stand for Charlie. Today, we were his family and now, he is finally home,' State Rep. Steve Xiarhos wrote in a tribute [Zachary Rogers](/author/zachary-rogers) Dozens of strangers and one long-lost friend gathered Friday to honor a [Vietnam](https://themessenger.com/search?s=Vietnam) veteran who has passed away after battling terminal cancer alone. Army Veteran Charles â€œCharlieâ€ Connolly, 78, was homeless and had no family at the time of his death on Dec. 18, according to Massachusetts State Rep. [Steve Xiarhos.](https://www.facebook.com/events/7050871481659351?ref=newsfeed) For that reason, the public was invited to attend Connollyâ€™s funeral at the Massachusetts National Cemetery in Bourne. â€œHundredsâ€ showed up, Xiarhos says. â€œCharlie's story is a powerful reminder of the challenges many of our veterans face after their service,â€ Xiarhos [said in a Facebook post.](https://www.facebook.com/xiarhosforrep/posts/pfbid06DaGb6TUtoPmBQ5AB2suLKQKmjm7XHGiDDfdJtKZTTc693L8GYySyz8bKgpvKpYZl) â€œHis journey, marked by courage and resilience, ended in the compassionate care of the Veterans Affairs Hospice Unit in Brockton. Despite the lack of family by his side, Charlie's spirit was never alone.â€ Xiarhos, who says he is a Gold Star father, adds that he understands â€œthe pain of loss and the importance of remembrance.â€ â€œMy own journey of grief has taught me that we, as a community, must be the family for those who have none,â€ Xiarhos added. â€œIn honoring Charlie, we not only pay tribute to his life and service but also uphold our duty to support and remember every veteran who has served our nation.â€ Connolly was buried in the stateâ€™s national cemetery among 78,000 other heroes in what was a full military funeral according to the state representative. After hearing about Connolly's passing and funeral on the local news, an old friend of the veteran was able to reach out and attend the service, even receiving Connollyâ€™s burial flag, [Boston 25 News reports.](https://www.boston25news.com/news/local/vietnam-vet-who-fought-terminal-diagnosis-alone-buried-full-service-funeral-bourne/B7E624BEUZDCVB6CBVDAH7HE4Y/) [Vietnam Vet With Cancer Brutally Beaten to Death in â€˜Unprovoked and Irrationalâ€™ Attack: Prosecutors](/news/vietnam-vet-with-cancer-brutally-beaten-to-death-in-unprovoked-and-irrational-attack-prosecutors?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Pink Honors Her Dad, a Vietnam Veteran, on Anniversary of His Death](/entertainment/pink-honors-dad-death-anniversary?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [A Terminally Ill Army Vet Posted His Final Wish on Reddit. Now He Gets to Shoot Gunnery One Last Time](/news/terminally-ill-army-veteran-final-wish-reddit-shooting-gunnery-one-last-time?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [All US National Parks Are Free on Veterans Day](/news/all-us-national-parks-are-free-on-veterans-day?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [11 Ways You Can Show Your Appreciation on Veterans Day](/news/11-ways-you-can-show-your-appreciation-on-veterans-day?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Missing Veteran Killed in Vietnam to Be Laid to Rest in Utah After 50 Years](/news/missing-veteran-ralph-jim-chipman-killed-in-vietnam-to-be-laid-to-rest-in-utah?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) "As we laid Charlie to rest in this hallowed groundsâ€¦ let his memory be a beacon that guides our actions in supporting our veterans,â€ Xiarhos said in his post. â€œMay God bless Charlie Connolly, and all who took the time to Stand for Charlie. Today, we were his family and now, he is finally home.â€ [privacy policy](/info/privacy-policy)and [terms of use](/info/terms-of-use). - Frustrated Dem Maverick Joe Lieberman Stumps for â€˜No Labelsâ€™ Third Option to Political PartiesPolitics - 2023â€™s Most Heartwarming Stories Include Incredible Tales of Survival, Selflessness and JoyNews - Who Killed a Maryland Mom of 5, a Model in LA and a Pregnant Teen in Texas? Mystery Lingers in 2023â€™s Unsolved MurdersNews - Casey Anthonyâ€™s Dad Takes Lie Detector Test: â€˜I Certainly Didnâ€™t Do Anything to My Granddaughterâ€™News - US Forces Shoot Down Ballistic Missiles in Red Sea, Kill Gunmen in Attack by Yemenâ€™s Houthi RebelsNews - Australians, New Zealanders Prepare to Be Among First Nations to Ring in 2024 with FireworksNews - Hereâ€™s How You Can Keep Your Pets Calm and Safe During New Yearâ€™s Eve FireworksNews - The 5 People Who Defined 2023 in Global AffairsNews - Prisoners Who Escaped in 2023: The Yearâ€™s Wildest Manhunts and How They EndedNews - Texas Man With Alzheimerâ€™s Attacked After He Tried to Get Into Wrong Car in Brutal Beating Caught on CameraNews - Michigan House Explosion Kills at Least 4: â€˜It Went Off Like a Bombâ€™News - New York Cop Kills Wife and Sons, 10 and 12, Before Shooting Himself in Their HomeNews

author: Alana Loftus
title: Trump 'turns dictator' and signs executive orders to personally take down whistleblowers - Irish Star
text:
Trump signed an executive order this afternoon, directing the Department Of Justice to investigate two former White House employees, one of whom admitted to being part of the "resistance" inside Trump's first administration.
Miles Taylor, an intelligence expert, was an appointee who served in the Department of Homeland Security from 2017 to 2019, under the Trump administration. Taylor also served as chief of staff of the DHS. In 2018, he penned an anonymous op-ed in the New York Times, titled â€œI Am Part of the Resistance Inside the Trump Administration."
Today, Trump revoked security clearance for Taylor, as well as ordering the DOJ to investigate him, saying: â€œIt's time to find out whether or not somebody can do that. I think he's guilty of treason."
Taylor came under fire at the time the Op-ed was published, and later admitted in a 2020 book titled A Warning, that he had written the piece. Taylor was the first former Trump administration official to endorse Joe Biden in the 2020 presidential campaign.
In a 2023 interview with MSNBC, Taylor said: "A number of folks who worked in the Trump administration with me and have since spoken out against the ex-president, we joke darkly about the fact that in a second term, a number of us will be in orange jumpsuits in Guantanamo Bay."
Adding to his slew of executive orders since entering office, Trump also signed an order to investigate Chris Krebs, who previously served as Director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency in the United States Department of Homeland Security.
During the signing, Trumpâ€™s advisor said â€œChris Krebsâ€¦ this is a man who weaponized his position against free speech in the election contextâ€¦ this instructs your department of justice.. to investigate..â€
Trump responded, â€œWeâ€™re gonna find out about this guy too. This guy is a wise guy.â€
Trump mimicked Krebs saying, â€œThis is the most secure election in the history of our country!â€ then adding, â€œNo this was a disaster.â€
As he signed the order, Trump added that Krebs is a â€œfraudâ€ and a â€œdisgrace.â€
Trump signed the orders just hours after announcing that the "reciprocal" tariffs on China would be increasing to 125%. He also announced a 90-day pause on all other trade tariffs.
For the latest local news and features on Irish America, visit our homepage here.

author: Laurence Tognetti, MSc
title: Rising Cigarette Prices Drive Older Australians to Cannabis Use
text:
WRITTEN BY: Laurence Tognetti, MSc 1 Can cannabis be a suitable substitute for cigarettes as the price of the latter continues to rise? This is what a recent study published in the Journal of Population Economics hopes to address as a team of Australian researchers led by Curtin University investigated the economic relationship between using cannabis or tobacco over an individualâ€™s lifetime in Australia, specifically regarding the rising prices of cigarettes over cannabis over the long term. This study holds the potential to help researchers and the public better understand the pros and cons of cannabis compared to cigarettes around the world.
For the study, the researchers analyzed survey data obtained from the Australian National Drug Survey Strategy Household Survey from almost 100,000 Australians between 2001 and 2019 to ascertain behavior patterns between cannabis and cigarettes as prices of cigarettes increased. The team found that for individuals under 40, cannabis use decreased as cigarette prices increased, with no changes being reported for individuals between ages 40 and 50. In contrast, the researchers found that individuals aged 50 and up increased their cannabis use as cigarette prices increased.
â€œIn economics, we have this idea that people behave rationally, that we act according to price,â€ said Dr. Ranjodh Singh , who is a senior lecturer in the School of Accounting, Economics, and Finance at Curtin University and a co-author on the study. â€œBut different segments of the population will respond differently to price increases, thatâ€™s why we use the term â€˜life cycle approachâ€™ when looking at consumption. So, on average, increasing tobacco prices makes cannabis use go down â€” but the opposite is true for this particular age group.â€
Much like the United States, the legalization of cannabis across the country remains checkered, with some Aussie territories having decriminalized cannabis while others make it legal for personal use but not legal to sell.
What new connections between cannabis and tobacco will researchers make in the coming years and decades? Only time will tell, and this is why we science!
As always, keep doing science & keep looking up!
Sources: Journal of Population Economics , EurekAlert!
Share About the Author Laurence Tognetti, MSc Master's (MA/MS/Other) Laurence Tognetti is a six-year USAF Veteran who earned both a BSc and MSc from the School of Earth and Space Exploration at Arizona State University. Laurence is extremely passionate about outer space and science communication, and is the author of "Outer Solar System Moons: Your Personal 3D Journey". author: VNExplorer
title: Colorado's active homegrown top draft picks
text: usatsi_22874713_168400956_lowres Nathan MacKinnon is the Colorado Avalanche's only No. 1 overall draft pick but other first-rounders have thrived in burgundy and blue. Three current top picks have elevated their play to elite status â€” Gabriel Landeskog, Mikko Rantanen and Cale Makar. The 2023-24 season was a career-best for MacKinnon and Makar and a second-best for Rantanen. The star forwards and defenseman led the Avalanche to earn 107 points but the team was eliminated from the Stanley Cup Playoffs in the second round by the Dallas Stars. MacKinnon was the top overall choice in the 2013 NHL Entry Draft and has proven his worth with only one fewer than 50 points season and two with more than 100. He is a finalist for the Hart Memorial Trophy this season and has been in the running for the accolade three other years. Colorado drafted its captain second overall in 2011 and although he has missed the last two seasons due to a knee injury, Landeskog has played a crucial role on and off the ice. "We can't go and get a guy the caliber, player or the person that that Gabe is. His injury has been challenging in a lot of ways but not more challenging than what he's going through," GM Chris MacFarland said. "He loves the game. He's a massive cog in what we're trying to do. And he's earned the right to have as much time as it takes to get back on the ice." The 6-foot-1 Swedish native has only fallen short of at least 50 points in two of his 11 NHL seasons and earned his career-high 75 points in the 2018-19 season. He led his team to a Stanley Cup in 2022 but has been recovering from a knee injury he sustained during the 2020-21 season. He underwent cartilage replacement surgery in May 2023 and is hoping to return to the ice sometime during the 2024-25 season. At the age of 25, Makar has already proven to be one of the best defensemen in NHL history and made several records lists. Colorado took him fourth overall in the 2017 draft but he remained at the University of Massachusetts and earned the Hobey Baker Award before joining the Avalanche during the 2019 Stanley Cup Playoffs. He scored his first-ever NHL goal in his first-ever NHL game and won the Calder Trophy. After winning the Cup in 2022, he was awarded the Conn Smythe and Norris Trophy and has been a finalist for the NHL's top defenseman award every season since entering the league. As one of the most underrated players in the NHL, Rantanen has improved every season since the Avalanche drafted him 10th overall in 2015. The 27-year-old Finn earned 104 points last season and 105 the previous season for a career-high, and has played a major role in the team's success on the top line with MacKinnon. The Avalanche's poster franchise player and now president of hockey operations, Joe Sakic, has been in the front office through all four top draft players still active with the team. Rantanen's contract is up after next season but the other three are committed to long-term deals to stay in Colorado for a while.
